content.description: Sit start under the notch, climb straight up
content.location: Crimpin Boulder, between Hold Me Squeeze Me and Hell Toupee

climbs.name: New River School of Pinchcraft and Crimpery

content.description: Sit start on a large block under the low roof.  Climb out of the roof, then up the arete to the top.  The low pedestal feet are on.
content.location:
Located on the arete on the backside of the boulder, opposite of

Crimpin' Ain't Easy

.

content.description: Stand Start 5 ft. left of the arete. Climb up using good hands, look for a right sidepull for a topout crux.
content.location: Right most problem on the Crimpin' boulder in the New River Gorge Bouldering Guidebook.

content.description: A fun climb on good holds with a small roof at the top.  The route is on the taller side and is great to practice topping out in exposed situations.
content.protection: 2 to 3 crash pads with a spotter to move pads.  The route is on the taller side and the top out can be tough for the grade because of the roof.
content.location: In the middle of the Crimpin Boulder.  Look for a low slot with a hand-sized crack above it at the lip.

content.description: The smallest hold is the start hold that is a full pad crimp.  Stand start there on the chalked up crimper, and follow that to giant but sharp jugs.  The crux of this problem, as with all the others on this side of the boulder, is the topout.
content.protection: Big pads will be appreciated on this one if this is at your limit.
content.location: The left-most problem on this side of the boulder.  Look for the start hold.

content.description:
Good warmup and an even better view.

Sit start with your hands on the edge of the pedestal. Climb up on decent holds with plenty of good feet.
content.location: On the cliff side of the Crimpin' Boulder, right up in the middle to the left of the cave. See New River Gorge Bouldering Book for exact details.
